info.description: Access to a Pydio Server. Second version of the API.
info.title: Pydio API V2

get.description:
Get information about a node and its metadata. By default, it will return 
Pydio "primary" metadata (stat, internal informations). Extended metadata can
be added by some plugins.  
For collections (folders), pass the **children** parameter to list its content.  
To access the actual content of the nodes, see the I/O API.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Workspace id or alias + full path to the node, e.g. "/my-files/path/to/node"

parameters.name: meta
parameters.description: Level of precision for expected metadata

parameters.name: children
parameters.description: Load children if node is a collection

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.description: If requiring children, load grandchildren recursively

parameters.name: max_depth
parameters.description: If requiring children recursively, stop at the given depth. If -1, no limit.

parameters.name: max_nodes
parameters.description: If requiring children recursively, stop at the given depth. If -1, no limit.

parameters.name: remote_order
parameters.description: Apply server-side sorting

parameters.name: order_column
parameters.description: Order column to use for server-side sorting

parameters.name: order_direction
parameters.description: Order direction to use for server-side sorting (asc or desc)

parameters.name: page_position
parameters.description: For a single file, try to detect the page position in the parent node listing.

parameters.name: X-Indexation-Required
parameters.description: Invalidate current index and trigger a background indexation

post.description:
Create new resources or move/copy existing resources:
+ Create a new folder (pass a path **with a trailing slash**), or a new empty file (no trailing slash).
+ Copy a resource to a new destination: pass destination as {path}, and origin via copy_from parameter.
+ Rename / Move a resource : basically a copy operation followed by a delete of original

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Workspace id or alias + full path to the node, e.g. "/my-files/path/to/node"

parameters.name: copy_source
parameters.description: If it's a move or a copy, indicated the path of the original node. Path must contain the original workspace Id, as it can be used for cross repository copy as well.

parameters.name: delete_source
parameters.description: If it's a move/rename, will remove original after copy operation

parameters.name: override
parameters.description: Ignore existing resource and override it

parameters.name: recursive
parameters.description: For directories, create parents if necessary

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Workspace id or alias + full path to the node, e.g. "/my-files/path/to/node"

patch.description:
Update existing resources metadata (see I/O for content modification). Basic metadata is provided by core plugins, but they can be extended by other plugins.
For example :
`{"core": {"chmod": 777}}, {"user_meta":[{"metaName":"metaValue"}]}`
`{"bookmarks":{"bookmarked": true}, "locks":{"locked":true}, "meta.watch":{"watch":true}}`
etc...

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Workspace id or alias + full path to the node, e.g. "/my-files/path/to/node"

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Json-serialized metadata to update

get.description: Get resource content. Depending on the attachment parameter, will try to either trigger a download, or send binary stream with appropriate headers. Depending on the active plugins, may be able to serve: + Plain text + MP3/Wav Stream + MP4 Stream + On-the-fly generated images + On-the-fly generated thumbnails for images or pdf

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Workspace id or alias + full path to the node, e.g. "/my-files/path/to/node"

parameters.name: attachment
parameters.description: if set, send back a force-download, otherwise use Accept header to try to find the best response Content-Type.

parameters.name: additional_parameters
parameters.description:
some plugin can take more parameters to send various contents
derived from main resource. For example, for images, you can pass
get_thumb & dimension

put.description: Create or update resource by posting to Input Stream

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Workspace id or alias + full path to the node, e.g. "/my-files/path/to/node"

parameters.name: raw
parameters.description: binary data

parameters.name: X-Rename-If-Exists
parameters.description: Automatically increment filename if it already exists

parameters.name: X-Append-To
parameters.description: Append uploaded data at the end of existing file

parameters.name: X-Partial-Upload
parameters.description: If the current put is a part of a file. If set, the X-Partial-Target-Bytesize header is required.

parameters.name: X-Partial-Target-Bytesize
parameters.description: In case of partial upload, the size of the full file as expected at the end of upload.

get.description: List tasks currently running on the server (and visible to the current user).

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: additional filters for task listing (JSON serialized)

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: Id or Alias of the workspace

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: One or more node pathes

get.description: Get information about a currently running task Id

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Task to monitor on the server

post.description: Create a task on the server. This will generally trigger a server-side background "Task", which ID will be returned in the PydioResponse['tasks'] array

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Task to launch on the server

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: JSON Task object

delete.description: Update a task on the server.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Task to delete on the server

patch.description: Update a task on the server.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: Task to update on the server

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: JSON Diff describing the patches to apply on the task object

get.description: List accessible workspace for currently logged user. Alias for /state/?xPath=user/repositories
List accessible workspace for currently logged user. Alias for /state/?xPath=user/repositories
List accessible workspace for currently logged user. Alias for /state/?xPath=user/preferences

Get information about the given workspace.
Info can be gathered via various plugins. Pass the expected metadata type via the X-Pydio-Ws-Info header. Currently supported values are quota|info|changes

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: Id or Alias of the workspace

get.description:
Sends back all changes since a given sequence ID.  

This plugin requires **meta.syncable** active on the workspace.

parameters.name: sequenceId
parameters.description: File to upload

parameters.name: workspaceId
parameters.description: Id or Alias of the workspace

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format produced in output (defaults to xml)

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: list children of the current resource

200.description: A user/group or list of users and groups

post.description: Create a new user or a new group with this path. To create a user,  make sure to pass a userPass parameter. Otherwise it will create a  group.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format produced in output (defaults to xml)

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: User or group identifier, including full group path

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description: Wether it's a user or a group

parameters.name: groupLabel
parameters.description: Label of the new group if we are creating a group

parameters.name: userPass
parameters.description: Password of the new user if we are creating a user

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format produced in output (defaults to xml)

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: User or group identifier, including full group path

patch.description:
Update user or group specific data with this path. Use resourceType parameter to discriminate, and send a parameterName/parameterValue couple to be patched.

Authorized parameterName values are described below, along with the parameterValue corresponding specification: 
- For groups
  - groupLabel : relabel an existing group
- For users
  - userPass: change user password
  - userProfile: update user profile
  - userLock: set/remove a lock on a user. Value must be a lockname:lockvalue string where lockvalue is "true" or "fale".
  - userRoles: Bunch update roles, eventually reorder them, as a JSON encoded array.
  - userAddRole: add a role to the user
  - userRemoveRole: remove a role currently applied to the user.
  - userPreferences: a JSON associative array of key/values to update.

To edit user/group permissions or parameters, use the role api instead,  using the object specific role_id (AJXP_GRP_/groupPath or AJXP_USR_/userId).

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format produced in output (defaults to xml)

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: User or group identifier, including full group path

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description: Wether it's a user or a group

parameters.name: patch-tuple
parameters.description: parameterName / parameterValue association

200.description: All information of shares on this node

PydioResponse.title: PydioResponse
PydioResponse.description: Generic container for messages after successful operations or errors

Task.title: Task
Task.description: Background operation started on the server. It's the client mission to check it on a regular basis.

BgAction.title: BgAction
BgAction.description: triggers a background action on the client side

Node.title: Node
Node.description: A file or folder represented as a generic resource, including metadata and children. Properties before children are part of the "standard" metadat set, properties after are returned by the "extended" metadata set.

update.description: Nodes may have an additional attribute original_path

NodesDiff.title: NodesDiff
NodesDiff.description: Description of node removed / added / updated in the backend

remoteSort.description: additional attributes describing current server-side sorting

PaginationData.title: PaginationData
PaginationData.description: Additional metadata attached to a NodeList for pagination. Could be sent through headers instead.

ACL.description: Key/value associating workspace IDs and rights strings (r/w)

APPLIES.description: Set of profiles on which this role automatically applies

Role.title: Role
Role.description: Representation of a Role, central container of permissions, actions and parameters.

PeoplePatch.title: PeoplePatch
PeoplePatch.description: a key / value tuple describing which parameter to patch

slug.description: human readable identifier, computed from display

displayStringId.description: an i18n identifier to adapt the label to the user language

accessType.description: plugin name to be used as driver to access the storage. Resulting plugin id is "access.accessType".

writeable.description: wether this workspace/template is writeable or not (not writeable if defined in bootstrap php configs).

isTemplate.description: wether this is a template or a concrete workspace.

groupPath.description: If this repository has a groupPath

parameters.description: a key/value object containing all driver parameters.

mask.description: permission mask applied on workspace files and folders

AdminWorkspace.title: Workspace Definition
AdminWorkspace.description: Parameters of a workspace, as seen by administrator

MetaSourceParameters.title: MetaSource
MetaSourceParameters.description: A set of parameters for meta sources

user.description: computed number of users accessing this workspace

shares.description: number of children shared from this workspace

AdminWorkspace_info.description: additional informations provided by the server

formatParameter.name: format

pathParameter.description: Workspace id or alias + full path to the node, e.g. "/my-files/path/to/node"

workspaceIdParameter.name: workspaceId
workspaceIdParameter.description: Id or Alias of the workspace

workspaceIdFormParameter.description: Id or Alias of the workspace

peopleParameter.name: path
peopleParameter.description: User or group identifier, including full group path
